title: Ticket #6622: Configuration language conditionals behaving oddly?
description:
Given the following configuration fragment, the subsequent console log seems like it should not happen: 

CUDA_VISIBLE_DEVICES=$ENV(CUDA_VISIBLE_DEVICES:)
if defined CUDA_VISIBLE_DEVICES
    VALUE = "defined"
    MACHINE_RESOURCE_INVENTORY_GPUs = /tmp/condor_gpu_discovery -device-list ...
else
    VALUE = "not-defined"
    MACHINE_RESOURCE_INVENTORY_GPUs = /tmp/condor_gpu_discovery -properties ...


[root@ip-172-31-1-111 config.d]# condor_config_val -v CUDA_VISIBLE_DEVICES VALUE
Not defined: CUDA_VISIBLE_DEVICES
 # at: /etc/condor/config.d/01gpus.config, line 3
 # raw: CUDA_VISIBLE_DEVICES = $ENV(CUDA_VISIBLE_DEVICES:)

VALUE = "defined"
 # at: /etc/condor/config.d/01gpus.config, line 5
 # raw: VALUE = "defined"

[root@ip-172-31-1-111 config.d]# CUDA_VISIBLE_DEVICES=foo condor_config_val -v CUDA_VISIBLE_DEVICES VALUE
CUDA_VISIBLE_DEVICES = foo
 # at: /etc/condor/config.d/01gpus.config, line 3
 # raw: CUDA_VISIBLE_DEVICES = $ENV(CUDA_VISIBLE_DEVICES:)

VALUE = "defined"
 # at: /etc/condor/config.d/01gpus.config, line 5
 # raw: VALUE = "defined"

We'd like to understand this behaviour. It appears to be checking if CUDA_VISIBLE_DEVICES is in the hashtable, not if it's empty. TJ suspects there's a whitespace trimming issue.

  • empty as a conditional that either (a) is what we expect defined = to be or (b) like =defined, but succeeds on whitespace-only variables.
  • environment as a conditional that combines the call to $ENV() -- with the unexpectedly required trailing colon -- with the defined / empty conditional.
  • Changing $ENV() to not return UNDEFINED (but rather the empty string), or adding another expansion that behaves that way.
  • something else I don't recall right ATM.
